author_blurb.en: Translated for SuttaCentral by Sujato Bhikkhu

segments.en: “Mendicants, there are these five factors that support meditation.

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu saddho hoti, saddahati tathāgatassa bodhiṃ:
segments.en: It’s when a mendicant has faith in the Realized One’s awakening:

segments.pli: ‘itipi so bhagavā arahaṃ sammāsambuddho vijjācaraṇasampanno sugato lokavidū anuttaro purisadammasārathi satthā devamanussānaṃ buddho bhagavā’ti.
segments.en: ‘That Blessed One is perfected, a fully awakened Buddha, accomplished in knowledge and conduct, holy, knower of the world, supreme guide for those who wish to train, teacher of gods and humans, awakened, blessed.’
They are rarely ill or unwell.

segments.pli: samavepākiniyā gahaṇiyā samannāgato nātisītāya nāccuṇhāya majjhimāya padhānakkhamāya;
segments.en: Their stomach digests well, being neither too hot nor too cold, but just right, and fit for meditation.

segments.pli: yathābhūtaṃ attānaṃ āvikattā satthari vā viññūsu vā sabrahmacārīsu;
segments.en: They reveal themselves honestly to the Teacher or sensible spiritual companions.

segments.pli: āraddhavīriyo viharati akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ pahānāya kusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ upasampadāya, thāmavā daḷhaparakkamo anikkhittadhuro kusalesu dhammesu;
segments.en: They live with energy roused up for giving up unskillful qualities and gaining skillful qualities. They’re strong, firmly applied, not slacking off when it comes to developing skillful qualities.

segments.pli: paññavā hoti, udayatthagāminiyā paññāya samannāgato ariyāya nibbedhikāya sammā dukkhakkhayagāminiyā.
segments.en: They’re wise. They have the wisdom of arising and passing away which is noble, penetrative, and leads to the complete ending of suffering.
These are the five factors that support meditation.”

suttaplex.blurb: Conditions that help meditation progress smoothly.
